item.dc:creator: Fernando Paladini
item.content:encoded:
Currently I'm using KairosDB as my timeseries database for a project and sometimes I need to reset my database to default, that is, delete all data of my database.

I couldn't find how to do that in the KairosDB documentation, so I've found a way to delete the database by myself. I've posted how to reset KairosDB database to default on this Github issue, but you can find the same answer bellow:

# Enter Cassandra Query Language terminal
cqlsh

# Drop kairosdb keyspace (don't use "cqlsh>" before the command)
cqlsh> DROP KEYSPACE kairosdb ; 

# Exit Cassandra Query Language terminal (don't use "cqlsh>" before the command)
cqlsh> exit

# Stopping KairosDB (you can use systemctl instead of manual path)
sudo /opt/kairosdb/bin/kairosdb.sh stop

# Running KairosDB
sudo /opt/kairosdb/bin/kairosdb.sh start

Hope it help you!

item.dc:creator: Fernando Paladini
item.content:encoded:
Recently I've read an awesome post on how to use the Ghost blogging plataform alongside with Github Pages - in other words, use Ghost with a free hosting.

The article in question can be found here, but the author don't clarify some important parts of the tutorial. Based on that, I've made an Github repository teaching how to get a free Ghost hosting on Github pages.

I also made an interesting script (that you can find in my repository) that allow you to update your website with a single line of code. The installation process keeps boring, but now it's very easy to update your website.

Check my Github repository here, hope these instructions can help you!
